newsitem.title: USA: AFTER THE BELL - Employee Solutions drops.
newsitem.headline: AFTER THE BELL - Employee Solutions drops.

text.p: Employee Solutions Inc plummeted 5-3/8 points to 10 in after-hours trading after saying it would not release its financial results Thursday as previously planned, traders said.
Employee Solutions had closed at 15-3/8, down 4-1/2 on the day, before collapsing after the bell when the news about the delay was released.
"It's trading down at $10," one trader said. "They said they were going to delay their fourth-quarter earnings."
The company gave no reason for the delay.
Also moving after the bell, but in a different direction, was Oracle Corp, trading at 37-3/4 after closing at 36-1/8.
On a day when the stock market in general was down and the Nasdaq index lost 11 points, Oracle rose two during regular trading hours and continued its upward momentum in after-hours trading.
Oracle late Thursday said license sales for the third quarter ending in February were up 29 percent, that service sales were up 41 percent, and that its Oracle8 program will ship in June.
